creator: novelchip
title: Pulsing fluidic heart micropump
materials_required: Transparent PVC rubber sheet (1-2 mm thick)
Small diameter soft tubing (e.g., Cole Parmer Tygon Microbore Tubing)
Small containers (few ml) for air reservoirs
description: This project details the construction of a vacuum-driven, silent heart micropump using microfluidics principles. The pump functions by using two expanding and contracting heart-shaped chambers to push fluid through one-way valves, creating directional flow. The "heartbeat" is generated by a fluidic ring-oscillator, powered by compressed air or vacuum.
steps: Mill or 3D print the components according to the provided CAD files for the plexiglass top layer, PVC layer, and plexiglass backplate.

Cast a thin silicone rubber membrane (0.2-1 mm) on a glass plate treated with dish-washing soap. Mix the silicone components, pour onto the prepared glass plate, allow air bubbles to escape, and cure on a hot plate.
Mill a punch mask from two plastic sheets based on the provided CAD files. Flatten nails or needles to use as punching tools. Use the punch mask to manually punch holes in the silicone membrane.
Cast a thick silicone slab (2-3 mm) using the same method as the thin membrane. Punch four holes for the mounting screws, using the milled layers 1 and 5 as a punch mask.
Clean all the layers from dust. Stack the layers in the following order: plexiglass top layer, silicone membrane, PVC rubber layer, silicone rubber slab, and plexiglass backplate.
Align the holes in the membrane with the corresponding features in layer 1 and the mating features between the different layers.
Insert the four 2 mm mounting screws and tighten the nuts finger-tight.
Connect three small external air reservoirs (e.g., 2.5-5 ml vials or syringes) to the appropriate holes on the device using small diameter elastic tubing.
Connect a vacuum power supply to the central hole or a compressed air supply to the unconnected hole.
Inject colored fluid into the upper right hole with a syringe. Connect a tube to the upper left outlet hole to collect the pumped fluid and connect to the fluid inlet port.
Start the vacuum/compressed air supply and observe the hearts beating. Adjust the size of external containers to change the pulsation frequency.
